content: Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do.
author: David Wilkerson
subject: love

content: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn
subject: love

content: Love recognizes no barriers.
author: Maya Angelou
subject: love

content: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott
subject: love

content: Love is the bridge between you and everything.
author: Rumi
subject: love

content: We are most alive when we're in love.
author: John Updike
subject: love

content: Love does not dominate; it cultivates.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
subject: love

content: The heart wants what it wants.
author: Emily Dickinson
subject: love

content: Love is an endless act of forgiveness.
author: Beyoncé
subject: love

content: In love, one and one are one.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre
subject: love

content: Grief does not change you, it reveals you.
author: John Green
subject: grief

content: The pain of grief is just as much part of life as the joy of love.
author: Paulo Coelho
subject: grief

content: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose.
author: Helen Keller
subject: grief

content: Grief is the price we pay for love.
author: Queen Elizabeth II
subject: grief

content: Tears are the silent language of grief.
author: Voltaire
subject: grief

content: There is no grief like the grief that does not speak.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
subject: grief

content: Grief is love with no place to put it.
author: Jamie Anderson
subject: grief

content: The life I had no longer exists, and I’m grieving it.
author: Cheryl Strayed
subject: grief

content: Grieving is loving with your whole heart.
author: Unknown
subject: grief

content: Loss carves a space that only time can soften.
author: C.S. Lewis
subject: grief

content: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs
subject: motivation

content: You are never too old to set another goal.
author: C.S. Lewis
subject: motivation

content: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius
subject: motivation

content: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra
subject: motivation

content: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt
subject: motivation

content: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become.
author: Zig Ziglar
subject: motivation

content: Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you have.
author: Napoleon Hill
subject: motivation

content: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill
subject: motivation

content: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi
subject: motivation

content: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson
subject: motivation

content: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard
subject: friendship

content: Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, 'What! You too?'
author: C.S. Lewis
subject: friendship

content: True friends are never apart, maybe in distance but never in heart.
author: Helen Keller
subject: friendship

content: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
author: Woodrow Wilson
subject: friendship

content: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell
subject: friendship

content: Friends are the family you choose.
author: Jess C. Scott
subject: friendship

content: There’s nothing like a really loyal, dependable, good friend.
author: Jennifer Aniston
subject: friendship

content: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
author: Baltasar Gracián
subject: friendship

content: Good friends help you find important things when you have lost them.
author: Doe Zantamata
subject: friendship

content: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau
subject: friendship

content: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored.
author: Mark Twain
subject: anger

content: For every minute you are angry, you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
subject: anger

content: Anger does not solve anything; it builds nothing.
author: Thomas S. Monson
subject: anger

content: Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
author: Buddha
subject: anger

content: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll
subject: anger

content: Speak when you are angry and you’ll make the best speech you’ll ever regret.
author: Laurence J. Peter
subject: anger

content: Anger is never without a reason, but seldom with a good one.
author: Benjamin Franklin
subject: anger

content: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow.
author: Cherie Carter-Scott
subject: anger

content: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
author: Seneca
subject: anger

content: Anger is a brief madness.
author: Horace
subject: anger
